intro: Ionactis elegans, commonly known as the elegant ionactis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss. Ionactis elegans is often found in rocky areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in xeriscaped gardens.
